Key Arguments: The definitions of misinformation and disinformation are too vague and broad, potentially infringing on free speech and access to information.
The definition of harm is inadequate and could be used to suppress lawful public demonstrations and protests.
The list of excluded content is deficient, notably omitting independent news organizations and journalists.
The extent of control over digital platforms is concerning, with potential for abuse and targeting of political dissidents.
Notable Quotes: This bill is nothing other than a poorly concealed effort to shut down and control any voices that would otherwise unveil the lies, propaganda, and manipulations of the state.
The censorship regime that will be effectuated by the powers in this Bill will prevent the public from alerting their fellow members of the community to valid information.
This bill renders onto ACMA the type of powers that mirrors the CCPâ€™s chokehold on the dissemination of information in China.
